content: The game: Exteremly well detailed with troops divisions, stats but extremely biast against the British Army. Not balanced, at all. British troops for fact were better at aiming than militia. Militia are 'good' and british line troops are 'average' not even grenadiers,the best soldiers in the world at the time get a 'good' but an 'average' rating. Britan at the time had arrogant generals (mainly why she lost) but this is not an accurate representation of the troops and their training.
replyContent: This is at a time when muskets were pointed at the enemy, rather than aimed, that's why most line infantry are given fairly average accuracy stats in the game. It's also to emphasise how American riflemen would actually aim for specific targets. The British Grenadiers are the best soldiers in the game if they are used as shock troops.

content: I feel slightly disappointed, as I paid more than what most normal games cost and didn't get all I expected. Although gameplay was great, some maps were too tiny and ended too fast. Also, there were no cavalry units which I had expected. Finally, the sandbox battles were pretty much the same as the ones in Great War Pixel Soldiers. Also, will you consider a Vietnam War of this game? Or maybe a game with more sea battles and different types of ships?
replyContent: Thanks for the review. Saratoga does have more smaller scale skirmish battles than the other games. Most sandbox maps are shared across all Pixel Soldiers games. Vietnam is something I might take a look at in the future. And I want to have improved naval battle mechanics before building a mainly sea combat game. Thank you for your thoughts! ðŸ˜€
